person.persName: Joshua Fry Bullitt (Louisville attorney and 3rd District Court of Appeals Judge)

body.p: Jefferson County attorney and Judge of the Third District Court of Appeals. Attended Centre College and studied law at the University of Virginia. Admitted to the bar in 1844. Served as state representative from Louisville in 1851 and 1853. Partner in law with S. B. Smith in 1859. Elected Judge of the Third District Court of Appeals in 1861. Served as Chief Justice in 1864 and 1865. Arrested in July 1864 for his sympathy to the Confederacy, returned to Louisville on December 6, 1864. Fled to Canada and removed from office in June 1865. Married to Elizabeth B. Smith in 1846. Children included Johsua Fry Bullitt Jr.
